title: Sarah Ferguson wows in white as she makes first appearance after admitting to cosmetic surgery
text:
Sarah Ferguson wowed in white this afternoon as she made her first public appearance after admitting to having had Botox and two types of facelift.

The Duchess of York, 59, beamed as she arrived at the Street Child Afternoon Tea at Claridges this afternoon.

Prince Andrew's former wife, who is better known as Fergie, donned a smart white coat over a navy knee length dress for the occasion, and paired the outfit with patent black heels.

It comes after the mother of Princess Beatrice, 31, and Eugenie, 29, came clean about the 'tweaks' that keep her looking youthful ahead of her 60th birthday next week.

She confessed to having Botox in the past, but these days prefers two different types of non-surgical facelift with lasers.

Sarah Ferguson, 59, beamed as she arrived at the charity event in her first appearance since confessing to having had cosmetic surgery

The Duchess of York beamed and posed for photographs Claridges before heading into the charity event at the luxury hotel

Fergie beamed as she posed for photographs outside the five star luxury hotel, before heading inside for the charity event.

The former wife of Prince Andrew donned a smart white collared coat with a knee-length navy dress, and black patent high-heels.

Her red hair bounced on her shoulders, with a few locks swept back by a hair pin on the back of her head giving her a slight beehive.

After posing for photographs alongside the hotel's doormen, the royal headed inside for the Street Child Afternoon Tea.

Sarah donned a white coat for the occasion, pairing the chic jacket with a pair of navy dress and a pair of patent black heels

The event for mothers and daughters is to mark International Day of the Girl and raise funds to provide vulnerable girls around the world with the opportunity of an education.

Street Child was formed by a merger of an organisation of the same name founded by Tom Dannatt, son of Lord Dannatt, former head of the British Army, and Sarah’s Children in Crisis organisation.

The event is held as part of Street Child's 'Mind The Gap' appeal with all public donations made before 4th January being doubled by the UK Government.

The jovial royal even posed with the door-men outside the five star hotel before heading inside for the charity event

Sarah, who is mother to Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie has kept a low profile recently as she focuses on her charity work.

But in a shock move earlier today, the Duchess revealed she has had 'a lot' of cosmetic work done over the years.

As well as Botox, the Duchess admitted to having had two types of facelift, as well as stem cell therapy.

The Duchess beamed as she arrived at the charity event at the five-star hotel earlier this afternoon

Talking about having Botox 'a long time ago', she revealed: 'I really don’t like the frozen look. I’m so animated and I like to be myself. I don’t like the thought of needles and am very glad if I look well and happy.’

Sarah admitted she prefers having laser cosmetic procedures, which are pain-free and take just 90 minutes.

The Duchess confessed she now opts for an ‘ultimate laser facelift’ as it’s called, which is a quick treatment which can be accomplished in a lunch-hour.
description: The Duchess of York, 59, looked chic in a white coat as she arrived at Claridge's Hotel in London for an afternoon tea in aid of her charity Street Child, after opening up about her cosmetic 'tweaks'.
